item.title: RF Design Specialist II
item.description:
Description

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Engineers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Engineers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As an Engineer II, you will collaborate with peer RF Engineers and provide technical support to ensure we efficiently deploy network infrastructure to meet the increasing customer demand for wireless services.

Your efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience. Your creativity coupled with strong automation and big-data analytical skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building our wireless network to support existing mobility services and offer future new services.  We are searching for an engineer with extensive experience in both Macro RAN & Microwave RF design. 

 

Here’s how

 

•    Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
•    Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
•    Lead the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience
•    Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
•    Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Bachelors degree in electrical engineering
•    Distinguished for your 5-years minimum experience in a RF engineering team (specifically with Macro RAN designs)
•    With a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
•    Respected for your knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Recognized for your strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
•    Valued for your effective communication skills while collaborating with both technical and non-technical team members
•    Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
•    Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Masters degree in Engineering or Computer Science
•    Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx
•    Experience with some of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java
•    Experience with SQL, database design and development (MySQL, SQL Server, PostgreSQL Oracle, Hadoop, MongoDB…)

item.title: Junior/Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Description


Join our Team


The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives. Together, we will develop and execute strategic programs that will enhance the experience for TELUS subscribers and internal stakeholders across TELUS. Always wanted to work with a team of innovators and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You will provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployment. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.The team takes pride in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning models and solutions they develop and deploy and take ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing of novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web-visualizations, we do it all!
 
 

Here\'s How

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

Qualifications


You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, demand forecasting and optimization and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

item.title: Data Scientist/Engineer
item.description:
Join our team

 

Are you obsessed with data and identifying ways to harness and scale data intelligence across an organization?  Do you love technology, love to learn and have a global mindset?  Are you passionate about collaborating with fellow data professionals to drive positive outcomes for customers?  If your answer is yes, we would be delighted to have you onboard the TELUS Partner Solutions, Predictive Analytics & Customer Excellence (PACE) team to provide vision and strategic guidance, while driving flawless execution on the development and evolution of our analytics capabilities. 

 

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything; and deliver an incredible customer experience. In TELUS Partner Solutions, we work with telecom carriers, value added resellers, managed service providers and software based platform providers from around the world! Our mandate is to ensure that TELUS Partner Solutions is at the forefront of innovative software-based platform industry developments that will drive growth for TELUS domestically and internationally. You could be a big part of our success in 2021 and beyond!

 

In turn, we hope you’ll enjoy being a valued member of Canada’s #1 global workplace with a world-leading culture featuring extensive community-giving initiatives, flexible work environment including remote work, award-winning opportunities for career development, and a competitive compensation and benefits package.
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Data Scientist / Engineer you’ll play a key role in designing innovative data solutions and solving challenging problems, to drive continuous business improvement, and achieve best in class customer experience.  The possibilities are endless – at any given time, you could be collaborating to build a data warehouse from scratch, writing beautiful code, working with our internal partner teams to provide sound data sets, or developing AI/ML models to support feature enhancements for new products. It’s why we’re looking for a data superstar who is filled with ideas as well as the delivery-focused mindset to execute them! There will be tons of learning opportunities along the way, not to mention the ability to work with some of the best leaders and mentors in the industry.  All you have to do is bring your passion, great attitude, and grit. Are you ready for the challenge?
 

Here\'s how

 

  • You will provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments
  • You will expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience
  • You will act as a trusted advisor and partner, and collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies.
  • You will lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • You will collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • You will work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • You will Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • You will influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • You will develop reusable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • You will support and evolve our Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • You will build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Support a number of business critical operational activities
  • Continue to enhance our Business, Customer and Market Intelligence and drive actionable insights for our sales, marketing and care teams
  • Mentor, coach and provide expert guidance to team members

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, demand forecasting and optimization and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences with the ability to influence others in presenting ideas and concepts.
  • You have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster good cross-functional working relationships with peers, and internal/external business partners at multiple organizational levels
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile, outcome oriented and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast
  • You have strong business and financial acumen combined with an innovative and process improvement mindset
  • You are known as a continuous learner with a passion for technology and data
  • You are composed and poised in complex, ambiguous situations
  • You are a team player that’s creative, entrepreneurial, and willing to experiment

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • A minimum of 3 years of related predictive modeling/statistical experience
  • University degree and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science would be an asset
  • Experience working in the Telecom or any related industries would be considered an asset
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle, Postgres
  • Use of data wrangling and visualization tools such as Dataflux, Data Studio, Apache-Beam, Tableau considered strong assets
  • Familiarity with data mining, data pipelines, and deep learning platforms such as Elasticsearch, Pytorch, BigQuery, Tensorflow, Sklearn etc will be an added advantage.
  • Excellent working knowledge of GSuite Applications (GDocs, GSheet, GDrive, GSite, GSlides)
  • Familiarity or certifications with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows ( ce.g. JIRA)

item.title: Senior Digital Insights Consultant, B2B - TELUS Digital
item.description:
Description

 

Create awesome experiences for our customers.

 

Join our team

 

We’re a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most.

 

TELUS Digital’s mission is to make life easier for millions of customers – and for our team. We build smart, customer-centric and data-driven experiences for telus.com, TELUS.com/business and the My TELUS app.

 

Our team includes a passionate group of strategists, UX and visual designers, full stack developers, content managers, scrum masters, testers, product owners, people experience specialists, and other digital experts.

 

Our team members are leaders in local and global technology communities, we value and support communities such as: Tech Masters, NodeSchool, Ladies Learning Code, Women Who Code TO and many more!

 

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

TELUS Digital is looking for a Senior Digital Insights Consultant to play a key role in unlocking and driving outcomes for the B2B team. You will play a key role in crafting the foundation for analytics and drive key insights that will enable our team to deliver on our Customer-First Promise.

 

We are looking for a data-driven individual who possesses strong analytical skills to help assess the efficiency of our practices, programs and processes. You will also draw on your imagination and your analytics acumen to analyze data, draw conclusions and present results. Your creativity will be key in evaluating current metrics, identifying critical metrics and leading indicators. Candidates for the role will be passionately curious to understand the ‘why’ behind the data and passionate about the opportunity to make more informed, objective decisions for our team.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Understand team outcomes and processes to drive data decision-making within our team
  • Evaluate and identify critical metrics and leading indicators to drive feature adoption and clean and consolidate data as required
  • Design, implement and report on Operations scorecards
  • Perform omni-channel analyses, working closely with other teams and departments and understanding their respective data
  • Use technology and analytics tools to develop models and analyze our data
  • Use data to tell the story of our operations and find opportunities to improve our practices and enhance our decision-making processes
  • Understand and translate problems and needs into recommendations and actionable tasks for the team
  • Apply data science/machine learning techniques to address real-world problems
  • Map out business customer journeys across omni-channel touchpoints to identify gaps and opportunities in order to influence customer behaviour
  • Measure the efficiency of our existing programs through analysis of available data which will include identifying issues, forming hypotheses and synthesizing conclusions into recommendations
  • Develop creative ways to gather new data and analyze results
  • Connect the dots to understand the “why” behind the data
  • Actively seek opportunities to constantly improve our processes and perform scenario based testing to support your recommendations

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • A passion for how data can be used to uncover new insights, solve unique problems and drive effective actions
  • Be a strategic thinker and a bias for action and crafting and driving change
  • Be a master of numbers, statistics and data management
  • Be curious and creative in looking at metrics to identify and testing new critical metrics for the team
  • Have strong presentation skills with the ability to tell stories with data and master visualizations
  • Have the ability to influence and persuade team members and leadership team
  • Have strong financial skills and business insight to be able to articulate the business case & manage budgets
  • A strategic mind and a desire to get things without being scared of the details
  • A flexible approach and the ability to adapt and champion change
  • Highly organized with a demonstrated ability to monitor and manage high volume workloads and competing priorities 
  • Experience with SQL and relational databases is a must
  • Experience with Python
  • Experience working with GitHub
  • Experience with Big data related tools and technologies, such as BigQuery
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Domo

 

About TELUS Digital:

 

We want to work with people who:

 

  • Share our passion for all things digital
  • Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
  • Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
  • Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
  • View collaboration as essential to your work
  • Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
  • Embrace diversity and new ideas

 

What you can expect from us:

 

  • An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas 
  • Flexible work hours in a central downtown location 
  • A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code 
  • A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
  • Team lunches with a generous supply of healthy snacks
  • A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily during an impromptu hallway soccer match or social team outing

 

Accessibility

 

At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

 

Bonus points

 

Check out http://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.

item.title: Data Analyst
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

We are looking for talented Data Analysts to join us and help drive our large-scale digital transformation program. This program is mandated with envisioning and building the future of digital life products for Canadians - from immersive entertainment to connected home experiences. Working with our solution delivery and product teams, you\'ll be translating business needs into analytics assets such as ad-hoc queries, dashboards and reports that leverage our data architecture to make data-driven decisions on product evolution and benefits capture. You will also work closely with architects and DevOps engineers to design, build and maintain the data pipeline, data storage, and analytics services – using modern, cloud based solutions and tools.  
 
We are the Future Friendly Home Services DevOps group, responsible for the end-to-end technology development and operations of TELUS’ Optik TV services, video and over-the-top services, broadband network capabilities, smart home solutions and software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) solutions.   
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

  • The goal: together we will create industry-leading end-to-end customer experiences for next-gen video and digital home solutions, incorporating superior performance, reliability and flexibility, by design.
  • You’ll contribute to an inclusive, knowledgeable and highly motivated team, using SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) practices to frequently deliver valuable software to market
  • You’ll become a go-to expert on the data and underpinning analytics solutions under your responsibility and how they fit into the overall architecture and value stream
  • You’ll identify data patterns relevant for TELUS Business objectives and suggest actions to improve TELUS Business performance
  • You’ll extract value hidden in data available from the TELUS service platforms
  • You’ll unlock the power of cloud services, having the freedom to leverage modern big data technologies to shape key products and services that define us as an organization

 

Here\'s how

  • You’ll work with marketing, product and technology stakeholders to discover and translate business requirements into data and analytics assets
  • You’ll provide technical leadership across a broad range of data analysis functions including data modeling, structured queries, report design, SQL and NoSQL databases, data quality, data profiling, metadata enrichment and management
  • You’ll apply statistics skills to analysis, such as distributions, statistical testing, regressions
  • You’ll work with data architects and DevOps engineers to design, build, enhance and maintain the data pipeline, data storage, and analytics solutions
  • You’ll take responsibility for the components under your purview: understanding the data models and how they meet business needs, ensuring data cleanliness, quality, and query performance
  • You’ll collaborate on agile PoCs to demonstrate advanced data science techniques such as predictive and machine learning driven analytics
  • You’ll leverage DevOps values and your experience to drive design decisions that support key operational needs
  • You’ll integrate security into all daily efforts
  • You’ll effectively collaborate using SAFe agile practices to deliver value
  • You’ll leverage modern cloud based data analysis algorithms and reporting tools (see Key Technologies section, below)

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • Don’t worry if you don’t yet meet every requirement below. We are looking for experienced individuals with an analytical, curious and collaborative mindset and solid business and data analytics skills.
  • Minimum 3 years, (5+ preferred) in a data analytics and/or DevOps Data Engineer role, working with large data sets and high performance queries and databases
  • Ability to understand both the business and technical viewpoints in order to use analytics to provide business insights and actionable recommendations
  • Data modeling and analysis: Ad-hoc queries, report and dashboard design and build
  • Data quality assurance
  • Delivery experience using agile (ideally, SAFe) and DevOps best practices
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Bachelors or Masters’ degree in an analytical field of study (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Finance, Computer Science)

 

Key technologies

  • Cloud-based data visualization and analytics solutions (e.g. AWS or GCP suite)
  • Reporting tools such as: XGBoost classification, K.Mean clusterization, cosine similarity, Jaccard similarity score, Python, Pandas Python Library, Hadoop, Zeppelin
  • Other tools and languages such as Tableau, PowerBI, Splunk, ELK, and Python or R for data analysis

 

Great-to-haves / Your learning opportunities

  • Join us to refine your existing skills and gain new ones in these areas:
  • Qlik Sense, Splunk, New Relic, Adobe Analytics
  • MongoDB
  • HADOOP-based large data set processing platforms
  • Data science
  • Data architecture
  • Data pipeline, ETL and storage design, build and management
  • Data literacy and governance
  • Predictive analytics and machine learning
  • Video Media or Digital Experience Platforms

FFHJOBS

item.title: Senior Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

Join our team

As a technology company, data is central to our mission to create better outcomes for our customers, especially as we strive to deliver next generation networks like 5G; unlock the full potential of the Internet of Everything to power smart homes, businesses, industry, healthcare and cities; and deliver an incredible customer experience. Our Data Strategy & Enablement team is at the helm of building world-class data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced Augmented Intelligence (AI) tooling, high quality data, and a data product and platform-oriented culture. At the same time, this team remains passionate champions of reliability, security and privacy by design, and is committed to creating the utmost level of privacy and security protections for all data on our networks and systems. 
 
As Senior Data Manager on the Data Strategy & Enablement team, you will have the opportunity to design innovative data solutions and solve challenging problems, while making an impact. The possibilities are endless – at any given time, you could be collaborating to build a data warehouse from scratch, writing beautiful code, or working with our internal partner teams to provide sound data sets. It’s why we’re looking for a data superstar who is filled with ideas as well as the delivery-focused mindset to execute them! There will be tons of learning opportunities along the way, not to mention the ability to work with some of the best leaders and mentors in the industry. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll provide vision and strategic guidance to evolve from common static analysis to dynamic machine learning deployments, as well as expand our teams’ access to deep insights that improve the customer experience. You’ll work with a talented team of Data Scientists and other professionals to manage TELUS’ data platforms and offer the best possible analytics experience to internal stakeholders using the data. And finally, as a trusted advisor and partner, you’ll collaborate across various business units to accelerate the transformation of our platforms, improve the customer and team member experience, and drive business efficiencies. 

Here\'s How

 

  • Build and maintain scalable data infrastructure that offers a best-in-class experience for internal stakeholders including consistent extraction of value from the data
  • Drive data ingestion and processing in innovative ways that inform strategic priorities and decision-making across the organization
  • Foster continuous systems transformation as we migrate infrastructure and applications to Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
  • Build expertise in the team to expose efficiency insights across data platforms in the cloud
  • Manage our cloud data analytics platform priorities to make sure data security and privacy are top considerations 
  • Implement automation and monitoring tools through a test-driven approach and mindset
  • Drive the adoption of new cloud technologies to further advance TELUS’ data transformation strategy 
     

You are the missing piece of the puzzle with these skills

  • An expert understanding of data warehouses/Hadoop architectures and ETL processes
  • Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases and query authoring (SQL), as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
  • Experience with cloud platforms: GCP, Amazon or Azure (GCP gives you an edge!)
  • Experience with Python and software engineering best practices
  • Advanced knowledge in Hadoop, Spark and Kafka, as well as other data pipeline components
  • Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Airflow
  • 3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience

 

You are known for

  • Having a proven track record in leading data analytics platform projects
  • Getting excited by the opportunity to build a team\'s capabilities to create value and innovate through data, and doing so in an agile manner with a bias for action and speed 
  • Envisioning and delivering future technical roadmaps while inspiring others along the way
  • Being a senior strategist and mentor who is sought out when it comes to analyzing and translating technicalities into business implications
  • Demonstrating resilience, a questioning mindset, and strong observation skills and curiosity – you never settle for the status quo!
  • Caring passionately about your stakeholders and providing them with the data and insights they need to deliver on their customer and business outcomes 

 

Great-to-haves

  • Post graduate education in Data Engineering, Cloud DevOps or Advanced Analytics
  • Machine learning and data science knowledge
  • CI/CD experience

item.title: Product Manager
item.description:
Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team 

 

This is an exciting opportunity to take a leading role in transforming TELUS TV as the best customer experience and entertainment service in Canada. As Product Manager, Customer Journey Automation, you will be responsible for helping TELUS drive our ability to provide automated data driven, relevant, timely targeting and messaging to our customers in order to improve their experience and engagement with our TV product. You will collaborate cross-functionally with our marketing teams, technical teams and partner vendors in an agile manner as well as lead and coordinate various teams across the organization to launch products and services to market. 

You will be joining the Video Services Team in the Entertainment & Education Services group as part of Home Solutions Products & Services. This team bridges the business and technical worlds as we design, build and enable capabilities that provide great experiences for customers while achieving the best business outcomes for TELUS. We strive to be a leader in the market for innovation, clear and simple user experience, and content discovery. 

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 

 

Product Management is about owning the product life cycle, end to end. Applying customer insights and data-driven approaches, you will develop the product backlog and roadmap, gather requirements and then design, build, test and launch features that will be used to improve the customer experience. You will continue to monitor and assess post-launch to make ongoing iterations so that we are developing products and services that truly resonate with users. You will work cross functionally to drive out use cases to improve the customer experience and you will enable others to leverage your product features in order to improve the customer experience. As Product Manager, you will bring together cross-functional teams with your vision, inspiration and organization, and offer thought leadership in strategic planning, assessments and overcoming of obstacles together. 

 

Here\'s how 

 

  • Develop strategic product roadmaps and solid business case justification for new products and enhancements based on user research, data and industry trends
  • Challenge the status quo and experiment with new approaches, tools, and techniques to improve our business’ bottom-line
  • Demonstrate tenacity and resilience that enables you to organize and spearhead initiatives, overcome challenges, and create solutions
  • Perform analysis on customer data and work cross functionally in order to understand and quantify opportunities
  • Manage the delivery of your roadmap 

 

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle 

 

  • Fluency in discussing and understanding technical concepts, scope/schedule tradeoffs, functional requirements and user experience design by collaborating with technical team members
  • The ability to lead, collaborate, support and influence cross functional teams
  • Ability to cultivate strong working relationships with a large extended project team and influence those around you
  • A passion for technology, entertainment and the digital home in general with inquisitiveness and curiosity to learn more
  • A fast learner who has a passion for exploring innovative ideas, and can drive changes through process improvements
  • Post-secondary education in Commerce/Business, Science, Engineering or Technology
  • Experience in any combination of product management, software development, data science and technical project management
  • A passion for data and machine learning 

 

Great-to-haves 

 

  • PMP, agile, lean certifications or relevant experience
  • Big data certifications or experience
  • Experience with customer journey analytics and toolsets, such as Adobe or Google analytics

item.title: E2E Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team 
The Network architecture and convergence is a newly created, innovative team that is also responsible for cross-domain network architecture development covering cloud orchestration, network slicing, automation and assurance, data analytics and network exposure with holistic architecture alignment;  in addition to wireless/wireline convergence covering access, network, policy, subscriber data, provisioning and charging. With the fast evolving 5G ecosystem driven by rapid technological, regulatory, and customer demand changes, the level of uncertainty and complexity of this transformation is increasing. Still, the opportunities are greater today than ever before for industry players like TELUS. We are embracing disruption, reimagining network services capabilities, and driving growth by leveraging the latest technologies  

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together 
You are a E2E network data analytics architect who prides yourself on leading digital transformation by introducing latest technology  of artificial intelligence and machine learning models. You truly believe in the adoption of IT and cloud orchestration and automation, and data analytics to drive intelligent network operation that enables the efficient and creative growth of wireless and wireline networks, while reducing costs. Finally, your passion and initiative in translating and applying your learnings in wireless and wireline communication networks will propel TELUS’ digital transformation.

 

Here’s how

  • You will lead the cross domain network analytics architecture, strategy, design, and align data analytics with automation, 5G network slicing, cloud, and 5G network 
  • You will develop/design E2E network data analytics framework applied to Radio, core, transport, service and cloud (hyper scaler) domains, to enable truly artificial intelligent network with machine learning capability
  • Through collaboration with multiple teams, you will drive innovation in automation, artificial intelligence, and big data analytics
  • Create business cases to secure necessary capital for overall cross domain network analytics 
  • You will work with other senior architects in order to identify the existing gaps in the network  to get fully automated network with predicative model by Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • Architecture and design experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)/OpenShift Container Platform (OCP)/Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or Azure products
  • Experience with containerization tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, and/or OpenStack technology and networking (CNI, Calico, Multus, VxLAN, vSwitch etc.)
  • Skilled in Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools, i.e. Spinnaker, Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GCP Cloud Build,  Jupyter etc
  • Machine learning open source frame work  (PyTorch, JAX and NumPy,TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, Pandas etc.)
  • 5+ years of relevant IT Architecture experience, advanced technical and analytical skills, and the ability to take responsibility for the overall technical direction of the project
  • Knowledgeable in one or more development/scripting languages and orchestration/API tools  (Java, YAML, Shell, Json, Python, Keras etc.)
  • Advanced knowledge in SQL and Apache Spark
  • Well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • Knowledge of 5G network protocols and experience with network management are pluses
  • Expert knowledge of the software project lifecycle—from concept through design to implementation and test.
  • Proven track record of leading data analytics, 5G SA and automation projects
  • Creative approach to problem solving and an ability to work independently in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Ability to manage key deliverables as part of an extended project team
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to translate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences
  • A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field, Master’s preferred

 

Great-to-haves

  • 5+ years of telecommunications experience
  • Multi- or Hybrid-cloud architectures
  • Experience with Big Data & Analytics tools such as Kafka, Kinesis, Hadoop, Big Query, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, etc

item.title: DevOps Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team
 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.
 
We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
 
The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.
 
Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 
Here’s how

  • Build and provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Build platform for delivering insights using MLOps framework
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models

 

 

Qualifications

We are looking for experienced individuals with a logical, curious and collaborative mindset and solid DevOps engineering skills.

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a DevOps or software development role with proven technical and analytical skills, as well as confidence in making and owning technical decisions
  • Modern cloud platforms, SQL/NoSQL databases and messaging standards
  • Agile delivery (SAFe) practices, using DevOps best practices and a modern CI/CD pipeline
  • Experience building positive relationships and collaborating with a variety of diverse groups and technical teams
  • Technical skills around Terraform and Cloud Build, Python to name a few
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • A creative approach to problem solving and the ability to work independently to manage deliverables in an environment with high levels of ambiguity
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering
  • Key Technologies & Best Practices: CI/CD pipeline build and management best practices, modern IPv4 networking, web security design and management best practices, cloud integration, container management, hands on GCP or AWS IaaS and PaaS, Kubernetes, OpenShift, automation, infrastructure as code, IAM, API management gateways, test automation and code quality.

 
Great-to-haves/Your learning opportunities

  • Join us to refine your skills and gain new ones in these areas:
  • Microservices
  • Machine learning and Data Engineering experience
  • Telecommunications industry experience

item.title: Senior Technology Architect - Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team
 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. 
We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.
 
 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.
 
 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementing and performance tuning Spark applications
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technology, data processing systems (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on- technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice to have

 

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

item.title: Data Engineer
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team


 
The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

 

We are entrepreneurial and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment and that through meaningful transformation we can integrate dynamic change in our professional lives.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

The Data Strategy and Enablement team has started its journey towards enabling further digital transformation in our data and advanced analytics space. Composed of Data Engineers, Business Systems Analysts and Architects our team focuses on building and enabling best-in-class data platforms with a focus on migrating our assets from an on premise data lake to Google’s Cloud Platform.

 

Join a dynamic team that is paving the way towards digital transformation and enable teams across the organization to make better use of data. Make use of your analytical skills and ability to analyze and assess the impact of data on upstream and downstream systems and help clarify and define cloud-related business processes and best practices across TELUS. Help architect the transformation and modernization of our enterprise data solutions and the integration of Google Cloud and native GCP services and 3rd party data technologies.

 

Here’s how

 

  • Build data pipelines, provision infrastructure and secure reliable data-centric services and applications in GCP
  • Analyze data, build models and generate reports and visualization using Hadoop and Cloud infrastructure
  • Help integrate large datasets stemming from multiple data sources to be later used for data modelling
  • Identify opportunities for and implement automation in the development and production process to reduce upfront hands-on work
  • Capture issues with the data that impact key business drivers and relay them to the product management teams
  • Support the data pipelines feeding into our machine learning algorithms and models
  • Assist the extracting, loading, transforming, cleaning, and validating of data

 

 

Voici comment

 

  • Concevoir des pipelines de données, fournir l’infrastructure et établir des applications et des services fiables fondés sur les données dans la plateforme Google Cloud
  • Analyser les données, créer des modèles et générer des rapports et des visualisations avec Hadoop et l’infrastructure infonuagique
  • Intégrer les grands ensembles de données issues de multiples sources aux fins de la modélisation des données
  • Cerner et exploiter les occasions d’automatisation dans les processus de développement et de production afin de réduire les tâches manuelles en amont
  • Repérer les problèmes de données qui se répercutent sur les indicateurs d’affaires clés et les communiquer aux équipes de gestion des produits
  • Entretenir les pipelines de données qui alimentent les algorithmes et les modèles d’apprentissage-machine
  • Participer à l’extraction, au chargement, à la transformation, au nettoyage et à la validation des données

 

 

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You are recognized for your 8+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a technical capacity
  • You are sought out for your 5+ years experience of Data Lake and platforms implementation with experience implementating and performance tuning Spark
  • You are respected for your experience in designing and deploying distributed, multi-technolgy, data processing systemsgies (MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra, HBase, Redis, MongoDB, Hadoop, Spark or others)
  • You bring systems design experience with the ability to architect and explain complex systems interactions, data flows, common interfaces and APIs
  • You bring a deep understanding of and experience with software development and programming languages and Python, Perl and Shell scripting
  • You are experienced with Apache, its ecosystem and relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro)
  • You are familiar SQL-on-technologies (Hive, Impala, Spark SQL, Presto)

 

Nice-to-haves

 

  • GCP Professional Data Engineering certification
  • Google Cloud Dataflow and Google BigQuery experience
  • DevOps practices and tools experience
  • Orchestration and job scheduling platforms experience

item.title: Senior Security Consultant - Secure by Design
item.description:
Description

 Join our team

 We live in a fast-paced cyber-world where protecting our information has become paramount. At TELUS Security, we strive to always be steps ahead, tackling the toughest security challenges head-on with top talent and cutting edge technology.
The Secure by Design (SbD) team enables TELUS, at an early stage of its project lifecycle, to build secure solutions by following a secure by design principled approach. We carry out thorough security assessments, identify risks and provide expert consulting by way of security control recommendations to technology and business partners. 
 
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together  

As a Senior Security Consultant you will leverage your subject matter expertise in the field of cyber security to assess network/system/application design and implementation and offer consultation to enhance security postures. You will partner with IT architects, network engineers, and software developers across Mobility, Cloud, and IoT teams making a difference in protecting the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of TELUS services & information. In this specific role your key areas of focus would be security assessments for both TELUS & TELUS Health.
 

Here\'s How

Perform security threat and risk analysis, network, system and application-level security reviews on a wide variety of TELUS services, acquisitions and even product offerings which include Internet of Things ( IoT), Robotic Process Automations (RPAs) and Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning ( AI and ML) and Cloud. Assess network, system and application designs and implementations with a security lens to discover subtle security issues for unexpected threat scenarios including conducting all of these for TELUS Health systems too. Get the chance to collaborate with and liaise with many stakeholders, from the Privacy team to which you will provide data Subject Matter Expert (SME) recommendations, to project teams, solutions architects and technologists during their design phases to ensure Security is top of mind and up to industry standards.Apply security standards and best practices to recommend solutions for advanced information and network security requirements and plan, research & design information security into networks and systems with hands-on application of technical methods and techniques and policies and procedures.

Design and implement risk driven information and network security solutions and evaluate and design security and controls for new technologies to address such areas as infrastructure, security administration, user identification and authentication, data security, network and host intrusion prevention, detection and monitoring. Assist with and participate in the development of information, system and network protection policies, procedures, strategies and architectures to define and support TELUS’ information and network security programs while educating and coaching peer groups of architects and engineers on how to better design security into their various projects
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • 5+ years cybersecurity experience in Health, Software, Telecom or IT industries
  • Distinguished for your intimate knowledge of information/network security technology, audit and control measures, monitoring/investigation methodologies and privacy/regulatory/criminal legislation
  • Recognized for your advanced knowledge of application security, systems security and network security in emerging technologies
  • Expert in understanding and application of major security standards, guidance, and frameworks based on NIST CSF, HIPAA, ISO/IEC 27000, OWASP, PCI, CIS, etc. to the realities of business and information security
  • Valued for your leadership skills:
  • Ability to influence decisions of peers/teams with technical authority and trust based relationships
  • Ability to technically direct/lead teams
  • Ability to build consensus in team environments and manage conflict while striving for shared goals and objectives
  • Ability to mentor junior team mgembers and aid in their development
  • Ability to make decisions with imperfect information
  • Ability to admit mistakes and bring correction and course change in a timely manner
  • Reasonably skilled in project management and system deployment methodologies
  • Commended for your excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • With a university degree preferably in a technology related field
  • Regarded for one or more security or other applicable certifications such as CISSP; CISA; CISM; CRISC; ISO27000, ITIL
  • The candidate should have or be willing to undergo a Secret II clearance, due to the nature of their employment

Great to haves

  • 2+ years of operational, system administration, or infrastructure build and deployment in a security-focused environment, especially in environments pertaining to processing and storage of Health information (ePHI)
  • Knowledge of Health industry and associated network technologies (5-10 years)
  • Background in IT audit and technical project management (with a strong security component) will also be considered

item.title: Sr Technology Cnslt
item.description:
Join our team

Your innovative mindset, technical skills, and passion for growth will be critical in helping TELUS continue to grow its data engineering and analytics practices and develop effective systems and applications. Be part of a supportive culture where the customer is front and center,
motivating us to continuously improve and provide innovative solutions.

Here’s how:

•    Help collect, consolidate, transport and analyze data and communicate alerts related to these 
•    Identify potential process and procedure enhancements, work on bug fixes and functionality gaps
•    Provide companywide technical leadership on multi-functional, complex systems
•    Collaborate and partner with various architecting, DevOps engineering and project management teams and vendors and internal clients
•    Ensure that the offered solutions are stable and reliable and offer the flexibility to promote revenue, meeting customer specific requirements and client business growth within TELUS all while ensuring that it remains best-in-class
•    Provide and implement architecture solutions that meet the team’s and customers’ business requirements

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle:
•    You are able to formulate strategic plans and to present them to senior leadership teams to secure buy-in
•    You are a forward thinker and use your technical expertise to drive business benefits and impact the bottom line
•    You are a relationship builder comfortable liaising with customers for systems, process and procedure improvements
•    You are a technical expert with core elements such as operating systems, databases and networks and knowledgeable of UNIX, Solaris, AIX, Linux and Windows
•    You are sought out for your programming and scripting skills and experience working in a DevOps environment
•    You are a self-directed, self-starting crystal clear communicator whether written or verbal and approach problems with an analytical mindset and problem solving skills
 

Additional factors that make you a great member to our team

•    University degree, ideally in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Java, Python, Perl, Bash and Shell scripting
•    Data Analytics skills and experience
•    Experience with Docker & Swarm
•    Experience using Machine Learning tools

Great to haves:

•    GCP cloud monitoring and logging – Big Query and Cloud Logging
•    NiFi flow development, Kafka
•    Kubernetes (or Openshift)
•    Ansible Playbooks
•    Hadoop and Hive

item.title: Engineer I
item.description:
Description

Join our team

As a member of the TELUS National Transport Design Team, you will be working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment responsible for developing and championing engineering standards, providing leadership and technical expertise. You will have the opportunity to work on next generation wireline transport, voice and IP technologies, as well as a variety of wireless technologies critical to the TELUS network.

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of optical and radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build a core telecommunication network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

Our Design team is responsible for the designing all Circuit Vision engineering designs through the National TELUS Core Network from leading edge 100G optical transport to 5G wireless to the automation in a DevOps environment. We are paving the way towards redefining how we build a leading edge telecommunications network through agile methodologies and innovation at the centre of our strategy. You will contribute to providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country by efficiently executing on a next generation solutions that leverages technological innovation, automation, tools and key partnerships.

Here\'s how 

  • Plan, prepare and execute the engineering designs and rollout of new wireline and wireless technologies to further evolve the best in class network
  • Develop method of procedures and business continuity plans enabling best in class network deployment standards
  • Collaborate with key partner within TELUS and external partners by leading teams through complex deployments leveraging your technical experience 
  • Drive everyday innovation in our organization through automation or process improvements
  • Apply a ‘Reliability by design’ approach during the new technology planning and rollout steps
  • Proactively engage stakeholders in establishing strong interlock and defined timelines and taking the initiative to resolve project related issues while modeling diplomacy and tact
  • Cultivate internal relationships with project manager, planners, marketing, engineering managers, and construction to ensure smooth workflow and strategic alignment with priorities

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle 

  • Solid understanding of all three levels of transport layers: Layer 0 DWDM/CWDM (both active and passive systems); Layer 1 OTN (both point to point and switched networks); Layer 2 (traditional SONET networks, Ethernet)
  • Ability to evaluate, refine and implement architectural designs based on your advanced knowledge of telecommunications technologies and architectures
  • Experience designing, configuring, testing and evaluating transport and/or wireless networks such as SONET, DWDM/OTN, and Packet Transport
  • University degree in Electronics, Electrical, Computer Science or Telecommunications preferred or equivalent proven industry experience 
  • Ability to manage through ambiguity using Agile program management principles to deliver new capabilities in recognizable iterations that advance a strategic roadmap of improvements and new opportunities
  • Coordinate concurrent projects and/or multiple resources to efficiently allow engineering resources to retire workload 

Great-to-haves 

  • 3 to 5 years of related industry experience in wireline or wireless network deployment

item.title: Sr Program Mgr - Reliability 2.0
item.description:
Join our team

Our Reliability Centre of Excellence team ensures that Reliability by Design is embedded within our network and services architecture and operations while maintaining a reliability-focused culture across TELUS.

Transparently, the environment is fast paced, intense, and demanding. There are no proven solutions to leverage, a steep learning curve, and continuous expectations from executive leadership to drive value for customers.  On the other hand, you will be working on a project that has C-suite visibility, an opportunity to redefine technology possibilities and capabilities, and transform the customer experience at TELUS.  


The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Project Manager, you will be at the front end making sure the team is on track to developing an innovative platform that drives unparalleled visibility into the end to end customer experience. The expectation is to go above and beyond your role in working with like-minded, entrepreneurial driven colleagues to build solutions that enable a holistic view of each customer, elevate our processes and service offerings and lay the foundation for personalization. 

How do you know this is the right challenge for you?  Quite simply, you are known as someone who:
●    has a history of successfully managing industry transformative projects that have a profound impact on the business or customers
●    is resilient and can lead others through high pressure, ambiguous and challenging environments
●    has the “know how” in leveraging rigorous and structured approach to solve complex problems

How

Intrinsically, you are:
●    Entrepreneurial:  embrace the art of the possible and take initiative in driving change
●    Strong communicator:  tell the story and get to the point in a clear and concise manner
●    Curious and inquisitive:  are passionate about learning and continuously drill down into a problem to uncover the root cause
●    Courageous:  are prepared to go to a place of discomfort and thrive in ambiguity
●    Inclusive:  collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and individuals with diverse backgrounds, and value different perspectives
●    Technology advocate: leverage tools and capabilities to drive insights and efficiencies
●    Action oriented: turn strategic visions into solution designs and execution plans
●    Customer-centric:  always look through the lens of the customer
 

Additional factors that make you a great member to our team

●    5+ years of experience in evaluating and applying statistical and predictive models (i.e. SPSS) including constructing algorithms, regressions, and clustering
●    Advanced proficiency in database querying, data extraction frameworks, data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence and relational database design
●    Fluency in programming languages: SQL, R, Python, Java, SASS.
●    Data visualization experience with platforms such as Tableau
●    Degree in science, math, engineering, computer science, or other technology related discipline
